document.title: James Moffett’s Lit Crit and Holy Writ

author.institution: Editor, National Council of Teachers of English

document.abstract: In one of Moffett's final presentations, he traced parallels between literary criticism and the study of scripture from various traditions. He explained the development of his Points of View spectrum as a response to his high school teaching experiences and presented an updated version of the spectrum.
document.publication-title: The Journal of the Assembly for Expanded Perspectives on Learning

field.name: acknowledgements
field.value: Charles Suhor is a former high school teacher, K-12 supervisor, and Deputy Executive Director of the National Council of Teachers of English. He conducts NCTE’s anti-censorship program from his home in Montgomery, Alabama. A co-founder of AEPL, his recent writings have been on contemplative reading and spirituality in the classroom.
